title: Killer is a Descendant of the Mont Blanc Family
theory: Some fans theorize that Killer from the Kid Pirates might be related to the Mont Blanc family based on physical similarities to Cricket and Noland, particularly body type and hair. The theory suggests the psychological impact of the 'Liar Noland' legend affected multiple branches of the family.
author: wellfine (Tumblr)

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: References characters and events from later arcs including Sabaody and beyond

title: Noland's Connection to the D. Clan or Secret Water Clan
theory: Fans have speculated that Mont Blanc Noland might be connected to significant clans in One Piece lore, such as the D. clan or a theorized 'water clan,' based on his importance to the overall story and the mystery surrounding the sinking of the city of gold.
author: Various (TikTok/Social Media)

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: References later revelations about world history and secret clans

title: Cricket's Sea Level Theory Foreshadows World Flooding
theory: Mont Blanc Cricket's observations about sea levels and the enormous cavity beneath the sea have been theorized to foreshadow later revelations about the One Piece world's geography and potential past catastrophes or future threats involving rising sea levels and world flooding.
author: Various (CBR, Reddit)

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Connects to major world-building revelations in Egghead Arc and beyond

title: The City of Gold's Ascent Mirrors One Piece's Themes
theory: Fans have noted that the story of the city of gold literally rising to the sky parallels One Piece's themes of dreams reaching impossible heights. The fact that Noland's truth was 'up in the sky' all along symbolizes how the truth of one's dreams may exist in places others cannot see or believe in.
author: Various (Reddit, Forums)

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains thematic analysis that references the complete Sky Island arc

title: Noland's Execution Was Politically Motivated
theory: Some fans theorize that Noland's execution wasn't simply about the missing gold, but was politically motivated by the king or nobles who wanted to discredit him for other reasons, possibly related to his discoveries or influence. The 'liar' story was propaganda to justify his execution.
author: Various (Forums)
